name: Centric Learning
description: We are a group of diverse educators who share a common passion for project-based learning. We continue growing in the U.S. and across the globe.

23772 West Road #342; Brownstown Township, MI 48183, US
220 S Main St; Suite 300; Ann Arbor, MI 48104, US

company_updates_collection.description:
WAY American School, the international arm of Centric Learning, was elected the best American High School program in Brazil in 2022. The award comes from The Knowledge Review, one of the leading magazines on education in the United States.

WAY American School is a high school program that offers an American curriculum capable of preparing Brazilian students to apply to American and international universities. All this is done through the Centric platform, which houses the curriculum in the form of hundreds of educational projects available to students and teachers.

Speaking about the impacts that project-based learning has had on schools, WAY Executive Director Thiago Pinto dos Reis told Knowledge Review: “We work with thousands of students daily, and the positive impact of PBL on their lives in and out of school is evident. The feedback we receive from parents is overwhelming, who notice their child’s improved communication skills, ability to express themselves creatively, and sense of independence on their learning journey, essential to their future endeavors.”
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
A WAY American School, braço internacional da Centric Learning, foi eleita melhor programa de High School americano do Brasil em 2022. O prêmio vem da The Knowledge Review, uma das principais revistas sobre educação nos Estados Unidos.

“Para encorajar uma atitude de um aprendiz ansioso, a base de aprendizagem de cada criança deve ser estabelecida desde cedo para desenvolver seus interesses e histórias”, escreveu The Knowledge Review no artigo que anuncia o resultado. “Ter uma experiência de aprendizagem personalizada centrada no aluno e compatível com seu estilo e ambiente de aprendizagem preferidos é o que a WAY American School no Brasil facilita.”

Falando sobre os impactos que o aprendizado baseado em projetos teve nas escolas, o diretor executivo da WAY, Thiago Pinto dos Reis, afirmou: “Trabalhamos com milhares de alunos diariamente, e o impacto positivo do PBL em suas vidas dentro e fora da escola é evidente. O feedback que recebemos dos pais é impressionante, pois percebem a melhoria das habilidades de comunicação de seus filhos, capacidade de se expressar criativamente e senso de independência em sua jornada de aprendizado, o que é essencial para seus empreendimentos futuros.”

company_updates_collection.description:
Amy Cook, teacher at Centric Learning and WAY American School, talks a little about what she likes most about the active methodology of PBL (Project-Based Learning).

Centric Learning
http://centriclearning.net

#centriclearning #learnatcentric

Destiney Smith, Project Manager at Centric Learning, talks about how Centric Learning’s PBL helps students and how it would have made a difference in her life when changing schools when she was a student.

Centric Learning
http://centriclearning.net

#centriclearning #learnatcentric

David Chen, a teacher at Centric Learning, talks about his perceptions on how Centric Learning’s PBL delivers what it promises.

"I truly do enjoy teaching here at Centric Learning. Why? Because they do practice what they preach, which is the Project-Based Learning method, or the PBL practices. This is truly important because, why? In my lifetime, I felt like I was not prepared. In most jobs, many careers and in college, most students have to work together to collaborate, to fulfill an assignment or a project.

Unfortunately for me, when I grew up and when I went to high school, we still worked on memory over learning and once I got into the real world I had to learn these skills. Therefore I feel like this platform does really help students for the future. At the same time, students can work at their own pace due to their busy lifestyles.

Also, teachers can tweak their projects based on the student needs and levels, whether they’re IEP students, ELLs, Honors, or GenEd. And so this is the reason why I continue and enjoy working at Centric because it is truly student-centered. at Centric Learning we really care about the students."

Centric Learning
http://centriclearning.net

#centriclearning #learnatcentric

We are so proud of our partner WAY program, Watervliet school district and Livingston ISD for their dynamic presentation at a statewide Technology conference sharing the effectiveness of PBL utilizing our Centric platform. 

Congratulations to all! Great job!

#watervliet #livingston #technology #pbl #wayprogram

Clayton Lovett, Social Studies teacher at Centric Learning, talks about how our tools provide flexibility and agility in education through Project-Based Learning (PBL).

"What I love about PBL is that teachers can get to know students as they are and then walk them in a variety of directions based on their abilities, their needs and their interests," said Clayton.

"PBL allows flexibility and agility in education and these things are enhanced by the tools that Centric provides us to serve our students. This allows students to develop these skills in a way that is interesting, unique and meaningful to them."

Centric Learning
http://centriclearning.net

#centriclearning #learnatcentric

One-on-one online live tutoring solutions are designed to meet the needs of all students. Our tutoring solution is designed for those students who are academically behind, those students who want to increase their ACT or SAT scores, and all those students in-between. Research has shown that tutoring has a significant impact on increasing content knowledge, standardized test scores, and overall GPA. Additionally, our tutoring solution can be bundled with any of our other learning solutions.

Learn more at https://lnkd.in/dX37NU4c

#tutoring #learning #school #solution #SAT #ACT #students #districts #

Last week we were at Texas Association of School Administrators's Midwinter Conference with a panel focused on how to use PBL to engage students and accelerate learning.  Watch the full video here!

An interactive discussion designed to allow the panelists to share experiences with students and the implementation of instructional PBL strategies to engage students and accelerate learning. Panelists and the audience also shared many unique strategies and stories during the session.

Facilitated by Dr. Caesar Mickens and with the presence of Beth Baker, co-CEO of Centric learning, Rich Klemm, Executive Director of the WAY Program, Pamela Celestain, ou Regional Education Specialist, and Heather Winter, teacher at the WAY Program.

Ann Merry Tim Merry Glen Taylor Jerry Nixon Thiago Pinto dos Reis Logan King Kevin Hogan

People talked about personalized learning, but it was really after the pandemic that they really understood its meaning and its importance. Our friend Kevin Hogan talked to us a little about this and how we can use technology to make it happen. 

Kevin is an EdTech thought leader and the host of two educational podcast series: EdTech Today (at MarketScale) and Getting There: Innovation in Education (eSchool News)

Want to learn more about what we have been doing to offer personalized learning to all of our students? Visit centriclearning.net

Centric Learning
http://centriclearning.net

#centriclearning #learnatcentric

WAY American School, the international arm of Centric Learning, was elected the best American High School program in Brazil in 2022. The award comes from The Knowledge Review, one of the leading magazines on education in the United States.

WAY American School is a high school program that offers an American curriculum capable of preparing Brazilian students to apply to American and international universities. All this is done through the Centric platform, which houses the curriculum in the form of hundreds of educational projects available to students and teachers.

Speaking about the impacts that project-based learning has had on schools, WAY Executive Director Thiago Pinto dos Reis told Knowledge Review: “We work with thousands of students daily, and the positive impact of PBL on their lives in and out of school is evident. The feedback we receive from parents is overwhelming, who notice their child’s improved communication skills, ability to express themselves creatively, and sense of independence on their learning journey, essential to their future endeavors.”
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
A WAY American School, braço internacional da Centric Learning, foi eleita melhor programa de High School americano do Brasil em 2022. O prêmio vem da The Knowledge Review, uma das principais revistas sobre educação nos Estados Unidos.

“Para encorajar uma atitude de um aprendiz ansioso, a base de aprendizagem de cada criança deve ser estabelecida desde cedo para desenvolver seus interesses e histórias”, escreveu The Knowledge Review no artigo que anuncia o resultado. “Ter uma experiência de aprendizagem personalizada centrada no aluno e compatível com seu estilo e ambiente de aprendizagem preferidos é o que a WAY American School no Brasil facilita.”

Falando sobre os impactos que o aprendizado baseado em projetos teve nas escolas, o diretor executivo da WAY, Thiago Pinto dos Reis, afirmou: “Trabalhamos com milhares de alunos diariamente, e o impacto positivo do PBL em suas vidas dentro e fora da escola é evidente. O feedback que recebemos dos pais é impressionante, pois percebem a melhoria das habilidades de comunicação de seus filhos, capacidade de se expressar criativamente e senso de independência em sua jornada de aprendizado, o que é essencial para seus empreendimentos futuros.”

What is Project-Based Learning? 📚

PBL is an instructional approach where students actively explore real-world problems and challenges 🧩

Students work on a project over an extended period of time, engaging in an in-depth investigation and often across multiple subject areas. This approach encourages students to take control of their learning, fostering critical thinking, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.

At Centric Learning, we're passionate about giving students a full learning experience when it comes to education 🎓

#PBLOnline #ProjectBased #ProblemSolvingSkills

As we celebrate Teacher Appreciation Week, we highlight the transformative power of AI in education through the stories of our AI Classroom Innovators. 🏆 

This exemplary cohort, part of the inaugural ASU+GSV AIR Show, consists of visionary educators who have seamlessly integrated AI into their classrooms, setting a new standard for educational innovation.

Our AI Classroom Innovators are pioneers in reshaping the educational landscape and led powerful sessions at the 2024 ASU+GSV AIR Show that inspired us through their innovative approaches and relentless dedication. 

Join us in applauding the achievements of these trailblazers! 👏 Celia Bonilla, Tim Brodsky, Dorothy Carlson, Stacie Chana, Ed.D, Jason Downs, Alyssa Faubion, Rachel Kent, Connor Mulvaney, Jennifer Roberts, Colin Sailor, and Kim Zajac.

Help students get back on track this summer ☀️

Looking to ensure your students stay on track this summer? As the school year winds down, our project-based learning curriculum offers the perfect opportunity for high school students to regain online credits.

✅ Flexible

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Ralph currently is the youngest student in our American High School program with Centric Learning. This is what he has to say about his experience so far with interdisciplinary, project & competency based learning:

"Hi! My name is Ralph, I’m from the Netherlands and I’m 12 years old. Since I started at UStudy Academy in November 2023, I’ve had a lot of fun working on the various, versatile projects that the platform of Centric Learning offers. The projects contain the most diverse topics, spread across different school subjects and they often are cross-disciplinary.

I greatly enjoy project-based learning. It really boosts my intrinsic motivation and gives me fantastic freedom to choose what I want to learn and work on. I can also decide for myself how extensively I go into a subject, and how much time (or desire) I have in a day to work on the projects.

Centric offers themes within the projects, accompanied by videos or texts. It happened once, that the content of this theme did not match my reference frame, my perception/experience of the world, and my calendar age, because the theme was too mature. I then shared this with the teacher at Centric Learning and with my mentor. They allowed me to skip that part, because the skill I could train with this theme could also be practiced at a later time, in another project. This open, correct and adequate approach from Centric Learning was very pleasant for me and gave me new courage and inspiration to continue with the project. You can tell that I am very enthusiastic about this way of learning!

Contact with the teachers (and my mentor as well) is also pleasant; I find them friendly and helpful. They also give great feedback and enthusiastic compliments. The teachers and my mentor respond quickly to the questions I ask when an assignment is not clearly described on the platform. Also, my experience is that my submitted work is checked promptly. Almost always within 2 days! I have been working at the Centric Learning Platform for six months now and looking back on that period to see what was the most fun for me so far, I made a list of projects I enjoyed the most - see below in the comments:

1. Video: It’s Time to Coast! [Visual Arts/Physics Honors]
2. Video: Investigating Video Games [English 09 Honors]
3. Video: Law of Attraction [Physics Honors]
4. Create a Mini-Movie [English 09 Honors]
5. Powerpoint: Curate your Art [Visual Arts]

I hope this wonderful style of education has made you as happy as it has made me.😄"

The nationwide teacher shortage presents challenges.

But it also provides great opportunities.

Right now, the common solution is to put a ‘warm body’ in the room without a certified teacher.

Instead, a better solution is to collaborate with online schools to provide:

1. Hybrid models - Districts with open positions can use online courses staffed with a qualified online educator and a paraprofessional in the classroom.

2. Expertise to leverage - Virtual schools can help overcome geographical and logistical barriers by providing certified teachers in specialized or hard-to-find subjects across multiple states.

3. Support systems - Online educators can act as mentors for local teachers in subjects facing the most significant staffing shortages.

Remember, online teachers can be an excellent resource for addressing the teacher shortage.

🔎 To learn more about each solution, check out the 2024 Snapshot: https://lnkd.in/gemMETKt

P.S. How are you addressing the teacher shortage?
